title: Senior System Architect
description:
**Systemarkitekt Kommunikation till SAAB** 




  





 För SAABs räkning söker Quadruped Rekrytering nu en senior Systemarkitekt Kommunikation. Saab är en del av så mycket mer än vad du kanske tror. En del av att du kan höja din röst och leva som du vill. Genom att tillverka världsledande produkter till försvaret är Saab en del av att skapa tryggare samhällen och förutsättningar för hållbar utveckling.
 



  





 Vi söker en erfaren systemarkitekt till Saab som skall utveckla domänövergripande integrationslösningar och kommunikationsprodukter för militära tillämpningar. Du kommer att ges tekniskt ansvar för att definiera och leda utvecklingen av olika typer av kommunikationsfunktioner och förmågor i nära dialog med produktledningen och den övriga utvecklingsorganisationen.
 



 Rollen är placerad inom affärsområdet Surveillance och enheten Communications i Linköping, Järfälla eller Arboga.
 



  





 Saab är ett företag där människan står i centrum. Man har en god arbetsmiljö där man stöttar och hjälper varandra att göra sitt bästa. Kontinuerligt lärande, välmående, karriär- och talangutveckling är exempel på områden där Saab alltid arbetar hårt för att säkerställa att du som medarbetare får de möjligheter som du behöver. Du erbjuds en lång rad förmåner som anställd på Saab. Det berättar vi gärna mer om.
 



  





 Rollen förutsätter godkänd säkerhetsprövning och svenskt medborgarskap.
 



  





**Dina primära arbetsuppgifter är:** 




  




* Arbeta i kunddrivna projekt och interna uppdrag.
* Föra dialog med kunder, produktledning och utvecklarteam med olika behov.
* Beskriva kommunikationslösningar.
* Arbeta med kravhantering inom tex IP-baserad radiokommunikation, radiokommunikation, 4G, 5G, militära infosäkerhetslösningar, infosäkerhet, militära ledningssystem.
* Arbeta med både hårdvara och mjukvara.
* Kravställa mot våra SDN-baserade kommunikationsprodukter.



  





**För att lyckas i den här rollen behöver du ha erfarenhet av:** 




  




* Högre utbildning.
* Ca 10 år i liknande roll.
* Bred profil som kan hantera krav från olika projekt parallellt.
* Hårdvara och mjukvara för militärt bruk.
* Arkitektur, vara väl insatt i processer för Systems Engineering.
* Radiokommunikation allmänt.
* 3GPP-baserade kommunikationsteknologier som 4G+5G.
* IP-baserad kommunikation av olika typ förekommer.



  





**Personliga egenskaper & förutsättningar:** 




  




* Du behöver inte kunna allt, men det är viktigt att du vågar fråga och ifrågasätta.
* Du har ordningssinne och är strukturerad.
* Du är driven, självgående och nyfiken.
* Du är en teamplayer som bidrar till hela gruppens leverans, kompetensutveckling och kundens nöjdhet.
* Du har inget problem med att rollen kan innebära säkerhetsprövning.
* Du är svensk medborgare.



  





**Varför Saab?** 




  





 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 20 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare, mer hållbar och mer rättvis värld.
 



 Saab är en del av så mycket mer än vad du kanske tror. En del av att du kan höja din röst och leva som du vill. Genom att tillverka världsledande produkter till försvaret är Saab en del av att skapa tryggare samhällen och förutsättningar för hållbar utveckling. Saab är världsledande i flera discipliner inom militära och civila produkter och lösningar.
 



  





 Ett resultat av långsiktigt arbete med innovation och goda samarbeten. Samtidigt innebär verksamheten ett stort ansvar. Innovation har alltid varit centralt för Saabs existens. Under hela sin historia har en innovativ kultur, innovativa processer och innovativa produkter drivits till att ständigt utforska, förbättras och bli framgångsrika. Saabs portfölj innehåller produkter som skapar försvars- och säkerhetsförmåga i länder över hela världen, tillsammans med produkter som bidrar till att minska klimatpåverkan. För att fortsätta att skapa värde på lång sikt är det avgörande att Saab bedriver verksamheten på ett miljömässigt och socialt hållbart sätt.
 



  





 Affärsområdet Surveillance erbjuder världsledande sensorteknik inom övervakning och beslutsstöd för att skydda mot hot. Portföljen omfattar luftburna, markbaserade och marina radar, elektronisk krigföring, stridsledning, flygsystem och cybersäkerhet.Communications är en produktenhet baserad i Arboga, Linköping och Järfälla. Enheten jobbar främst med integrationer av olika kundanpassade system där kommunikation eller ledningsförmåga krävs. Inom Communications jobbar man med hela projektkedjan från systemarkitekter till montörer. Communications växer stadigt och har 115 medarbetare i dagsläget.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




  





 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Saab med Quadruped Rekrytering. Hör av dig med frågor eller skicka din ansökan till carina.ronnby@quadruped.se. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande.
 



 Vill du veta mer är du välkommen att kontakta Carina Rönnby, 0761017770.

title: Enterprise Sales Executive (Chargeback & Fraud Prevention)
description:
**About The Company**
 Our client is a fast-growing
 **B2B fintech startup** 
 at the forefront of online payment solutions. With offices across Europe and a global client base, they're building state-of-the-art products that help businesses accept payments seamlessly and securely. Their platform processes transactions for 200+ clients worldwide, offering 100+ alternative payment methods and maintaining the highest standards of security with PCI DSS Level 1 certification. The company recently completed a
 **Series B** 
 funding round, raising
 **$50 million** 
 to further expand their innovative solutions.
   

  

* Industry: Fintech, SaaS, Payment Processing
* Product/Service: Payment processing platform, Chargeback & Fraud Prevention solutions
* Company size: 200
* Target market: Mid-market, Large Enterprise
* Ideal Customer Profile: CEO, COO, CFO at E-commerce with €20M+ annual revenue
* Average deal size: €500,000
* Average sales cycle: 6 months


 With Glassdoor and RepVue ranking them in the top 5% of all software organizations, they are recognized as a top-rated EU employer.
   

  

 The Opportunity
   

  

 As the
 **Enterprise Sales Executive** 
 for the
 **Chargeback & Fraud Prevention** 
 division, you'll play a pivotal role in establishing the company as a market leader in this critical sector. You'll be responsible for driving sales of innovative solutions including real-time technology for transmitting crucial purchase data and an automated dispute prevention and resolution tool. This is a unique opportunity to build a sales function from the ground up and drive the growth of a market-leading tech company partnered with Visa, Mastercard, and major issuing and acquiring banks.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Develop and execute sales strategies to position the company as a top chargeback and fraud prevention provider in EU/US markets
* Build and lead a high-performance sales team passionate about solving real-world problems with fintech solutions
* Cultivate strong relationships with key customers, partners, and industry peers to drive growth and market share
* Collaborate closely with leadership to align sales goals with product development and company vision
* Achieve and exceed ambitious sales targets for the Chargeback & Fraud Prevention division


 What You'll Bring
   

  

* At least 2 years in full cycle Enterprise sales (from prospecting to closing) in Fintech SaaS
* Strong network and relationships within the EU/US tech and startup communities
* Excellent understanding of payment processing, fraud prevention, and chargeback management
* Experience working with anti-fraud products on the market
* Proven successful track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets in the EU/US markets
* Strong client-facing and presentation skills
* Ability to understand and articulate complex technical solutions


 Key Success Drivers
   

  

* Results-driven, motivated by achieving targets and KPIs
* Proactive, energetic, and provides constructive feedback
* Excellent verbal and written communication
* Comfortable working in a fast-paced, ever-changing startup environment


 Why Join?
   

  

* Competitive salary: €70,000 - €80,000 per year (negotiable based on experience)
* OTE (on-target earnings): €140,000 - €240,000 (uncapped commission)
* Comprehensive medical benefits
* Work-life balance: flexible remote work environment, generous PTO
* Fast-track career growth and professional development
* Represent the company at the world’s most prestigious Fintech events
* Impactful work shaping the future of online payments and fraud prevention
* Collaborative culture and passionate, innovative team with a startup mentality
* Work with a product that has a strong market fit and is recognized for its excellence in the industry


*We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity, or expression, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.*
 Compensation Range: €140K - €240K

title: Advanced Analytics Architect & AI Lead
description:
**About The Position**
 Dometic is a global market leader in the mobile living industry. Millions of people around the world use Dometic products in outdoor, residential, and professional applications. We are on a journey of continuous growth – now looking for our next star – a driven and skilled Advanced Analytics Architect & AI Lead.
   

  

**As Advanced Analytics Architect & AI Lead at Dometic,** 
 you will be part of the new Data & AI Office and play an important role in supporting existing and coming initiatives within advanced analytics (predictive and generative AI solutions). AI and Advanced analytics initiatives are high on the agenda and will increase over the coming years – Dometic needs an architect to guide and accelerate the initiatives, that will mainly be driven from the business. The role is positioned at the HQ office in Solna Strand and you report to Head of Data & AI Office.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities**
* Keep track of advanced analytics solutions and initiatives within Dometic (portfolio management).
* Act as advanced analytics platform architect.
* Create guidelines and best practice around advanced analytics as well as establish and maintain an AI governance model.
* Guide, inspire and support the advanced analytics community within Dometic through leadership in Center of Excellence.
* Act in internal forums and advocate for solutions including advanced analytics.
* Participate in advanced analytics projects.
* Business stakeholder handling – throughout the whole organization.
* Act as early identifier of possible advanced analytics solutions.
* Contribute to prototyping of advanced analytics solution and give expert support for implementations.


**What do we offer?**
 You are offered an interesting role in a dynamic, fast paced and global environment with great opportunities to grow and take on new challenges. The growth at Dometic is continuous – which gives you great possibilities to evolve with the company.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**A suitable background would be a** 
 proven track record of similar roles, you are a tech-savvy communicator and have an experience as for example Data Engineer or Data Scientist. You can guide business initiatives in best practices – as well as possessing the following qualifications and experiences:
   

  

* Bachelor or master’s degree in IT or another relevant field.
* Experience from developing advanced analytics solutions into operational solutions.
* Familiar with Azure services and how to configure platform and setup services for successful advanced analytics solutions.
* Experience from different cloud solutions and setups for advanced analytics platforms and services.
* Fluent in English and excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to explain solutions and technologies to business leaders, and requirements to colleagues in Analytics team and other stakeholders in the IT organization.


**To be successful in this role, we believe that you possess the following skills, competencies & characteristics:**
* You are comfortable with guiding business representatives in their advanced analytics journey i.e., can understand business challenges and needs, translate that into solutions that meets the business expectations and bring value.
* You have the ability to operationalize developed and trained advanced analytics solutions into a production environment.
* You have the ability to see the whole picture, developing the whole chain from sourcing and cleaning relevant data into information model, prepared for analytical solution and apply applicable statistical models upon created data model.
* You have strong communication skills – and communicate comfortably at all levels in the organization.
* You are a structured, highly responsible and proactive person – who is confident and trustworthy.
* Finally, Dometic is a fast paced and dynamic company – this is an environment you know that you thrive in!


**And of course – our Core Values**
 To thrive and succeed in this role, you understand the importance of our core values – Together We build our future, We play to win, We embrace change and We walk the talk; these values reflect the heart and soul of Dometic and they define what it takes to work here and how we do things.
   

  

 Dometic operates with a 4+1 policy, 4 days per week in the office and the possibility to work 1 day per week remotely. We see the social aspect of being in the office, meeting colleagues, having short coffee break interactions or a quick face to face meeting as key to success as we become more productive and fast paced in terms of problem solving, learning, cross functional collaboration and not the least in a way to have fun at work!
   

  

**Are you our next star?** 
 Then we would love to see your application. Selection is being made on a running basis. If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Karin Fryklund, Talent Acquisition Manager at karin.fryklund@dometic.com
   

  

 In this recruitment, personality and logical test will be used as part of the process.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Company Description**
**Who We Are**
 Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the world’s largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviours.
   

  

 We are feeding the world’s curiosity!
   

  

**Job Description**
**The Opportunity**
 Our mission is to build Cint’s unified platform to increase Cint's global demand and to deliver an excellent user experience for both our buyers and customers. Also, to support the business in delivering high-quality answers to the world's most successful insights companies.
   

  

**The Team**
 We are looking for a skilled software developer to join our Demand team. We are a fast-moving, supporting, and curious globally distributed team. Right now, we are doing a lot of .NET, AWS, containers, and event-driven architecture.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**What You Will Do**
**Role**
 With a remote-first mindset, you would join an international team with the possibility to work from our offices around the globe when needed. Your focus in the role would be:
   

  

* Work across our entire tech stack, collaborating on the cloud-, and web solutions
* Take responsibility for the quality of solutions and that best practices are being used creating maintainable and scalable solutions with the appropriate technologies.
* Work in an agile environment where we are looking to continuously reshape our workflows, making sure that each workday is value driven, collaborative, and rewarding.
* Be a technical go-to person and collaborate across teams to align on architecture and cross-cutting matters
* With your senior skills and mindset, your role will have an impact on transforming Cint’s vision moving forward, by working with digital solutions/platforms/products.


**What We Are Looking For**
* Experience in software development in a fast-paced, innovative, and complex environment.
* You master one or several of the following technologies: C#, .NET, SQL/Redis, Docker/Kubernetes.
* Experience in developing serverless applications in a cloud environment, preferably Azure or AWS.
* Background in working with agile and iterative processes and practices like Scrum, Kanban, TDD, BDD, DDD as well as DevOps and CI/CD.
* Experience in working with event-driven microservices.
* Experience in writing effective unit and integration tests.
* You are a driver in determining, implementing, and continuously improving the architecture and the security aspect throughout the systems, tools and workflows.
* It is nice to be able to work with python, Java, and golang.


**Bonus Points If You Have**
 Do you have experience in Ruby, F#, Clojure, Erlang, Go, Rust, Haskell or other technologies?
   

  

 That’s a plus for us! We also support you in learning new technologies and back you to learn on the job – because we trust sensible developers to pick up new technologies with coaching and practice.
   

  

 Additional Information
   

  

**Our Values**
**Collaboration is our superpower**
* We uncover rich perspectives across the world
* Success happens together
* We deliver across borders.


**Innovation is in our blood**
* We’re pioneers in our industry
* Our curiosity is insatiable
* We bring the best ideas to life.


**We Do What We Say**
* We’re accountable for our work and actions
* Excellence comes as standard
* We’re open, honest and kind, always.


**We are caring**
* We learn from each other’s experiences
* Stop and listen; every opinion matters
* We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.


**More About Cint**
 In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish – the world’s largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region – and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid – a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.
   

  

 Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)

title: Regional Systems Operations Manager
description:
**Join Schneider Electric as our Regional Systems Operations Manager!**
 Are you ready to take the lead in driving our Digital Buildings Systems to unparalleled success in Europe & France? As the Regional Systems Operations Manager, you'll play a pivotal role in elevating our systems organization for Data Centre projects, providing expert support from sales to flawless project execution. Join us in shaping the future of energy management and sustainability!
   

  

**What we offer you:**
* Competitive Rewards: Enjoy a competitive salary, bonus scheme, and a range of enticing benefits including 28 days annual leave, pension scheme, and employee share ownership programme.
* Health & Wellbeing: Access various health and wellbeing support options, gym flex, and a holiday buy & sell programme to suit your lifestyle.
* Career Development: Benefit from our Open Talent Market, offering internal mobility opportunities, access to mentors, and projects globally, along with our comprehensive learning portal.
* Inclusive Environment: Experience our commitment to diversity and inclusion, with opportunities for all and support for those considering themselves living with a disability.
* Perks and Discounts: Enjoy shopping and dining discounts as part of our employee perks package.


**What your mission will look like?**
* Champion the transformation of our Digital Buildings Systems to best in class, from selling to successful execution of systems organization for Data Centre projects in Europe & France.
* Provide invaluable support to our teams and clients, ensuring excellence in environment monitoring systems and driving high performance systems culture.


**Key responsibilities will include:**
* Driving bid assessment, customer project performance, and aligned execution approach across the region.
* Acting as a trusted advisor, ensuring consistent customer experience and knowledge transfer across all projects.
* Ensuring the development, implementation, and maintenance of global rules, methodologies, processes, and tools.


**What will help you succeed?**
* Excellent communication and leadership skills to drive high performance and collaboration
* Analytical skills to handle complex matters effectively and experience in builduing management systems
* Professional knowledge of the electrical industry and experience in the Lifescience segment are valued
* Experience in a multicultural team environment and readiness to travel


 Ready to make an impact with us?
   

  

 Join Schneider Electric and be part of a team shaping the future of energy management. Apply now and let us learn about you!
   

  

**Why us?**
 Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.
   

  

 €34bn global revenue
   

  

 128 000+ employees in 100+ countries
   

  

 45% of revenue from IoT
   

  

 5% of revenue devoted for R&D
   

  

 You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled
   

  

 It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.

title: Power BI Consultant
description:
*Vill du vara med och växa med oss på B3 Business Transformation? Vi söker nu duktiga konsulter inom Power BI!*
*B3 Business Transformation stärker våra kunders digitala konkurrenskraft genom att vara datadrivna i sina processer, analyser och vid beslutsfattande. Med vår kompetens inom Advanced Analytics, Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence i kombination med stor affärsförståelse leder vi våra kunder in i ett datadrivet arbetssätt och möjliggör utveckling av nya digitala initiativ. Vi bidrar även till förbättring av den digital förmågan och etablering av moderna arbetssätt.*
**Om rollen:**
 Som Power BI specialist hos oss deltar du ofta redan i en tidig fas för att skapa insikter om de affärsmässiga förutsättningarna, identifiera datakällor och datastrukturer. Du har en bra känsla för hur man utformar effektiva visualiseringar av data. Vidare har du förmågan att arbeta självständigt och noggrant med Power BI, både som utvecklare och administratör. Du har erfarenhet av att framgångsrikt driva lösningar i mål tillsammans med olika typer av kunder i olika branscher. Du arbetar med kompetenta kollegor där leveransen kan omfatta flera olika områden men ditt fokus är att designa, modellera, visualisera data från en eller flera olika strukturerade och/eller semistrukturerade datakällor. På så sätt skapar du en effektiv informationslösning som utgör grunden till ett bestående datadrivet arbetssätt hos kunden.
   

  

 Du arbetar ofta i teamleveranser mot kund men även som individuell specialist. Du behöver även vara en god kommunikatör och en lagspelare som kan hantera många kontaktytor.
   

  

**Vad vi kan erbjuda dig:**
 Vi har en stark och dynamisk företagskultur, och tror på balans i livet. Som konsult hos oss kan du själv vara med och påverka din ersättning, arbetstider, kompetensutveckling och vilka slags uppdrag du vill ha.
   

  

 En ökad komplexitet inom våra kunders IT-miljöer ställer höga krav på våra specialistkompetenser. Även våra produktpartners kräver att vi håller oss uppdaterade om deras teknologier. Därför är det viktigt för oss att ge dig möjlighet att löpande utbilda och certifiera dig inom relevanta områden för att behålla eller öka ditt marknadsvärde.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* tre års erfarenhet av utveckling i Power BI samt relevant högskoleutbildning eller någon specialinriktad utbildning inom området.
* erfarenhet av Phyton, R, och Scala eller Power Shell.
* vana av att arbeta med agila metoder.
* intresse av affärslogiken i våra kunders verksamheter.
* ett proaktivt, serviceinriktat och positivt förhållningssätt till verksamhet, kollegor, chefer och andra som berörs.
* personlig drivkraft samt är van vid att proaktivt lösa problem och införskaffa relevant information eller kunskap när det behövs.
* affärsmässig svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.


**Du har kunskap inom några av nedanstående tekniska plattformar, lösningsmönster och verktyg:**
* Power BI – DAX-kod, Data Flow, rapporter, dashboards
* SQL-utveckling/kodning
* Visual Studio
* Informationsmodellering, Dimensionsmodellering
* Power BI Premium, Power BI Embedded
* Azure Analysis Services
* DevOps
* Qlik, Tableau, Looker, Cognos, SAS, BO
* Azure, Power Automate, Logic Apps
* AWS, Amazon S3, Redshift, Quicksight
* Google Cloud, BigQuery,
* Snowflake,
* Python, R, Scala


 Det är inte viktigt att kravbilden matchar dig just nu men du skall ha en vilja att nå dit och löpande utveckla dig själv och tillsammans med övriga kollegor utveckla B3 Business Transformation till att bli en ännu bättre arbetsplats.
   

  

 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på B3 och hur vi arbetar med vår wellness och våra sociala initiativ
   

  

 Klicka på ansökan eller tveka inte att kontakta Mats Erkers på telefonnummer:
 *070-539 47 05* 
 eller email: mats.erkers@b3.se

title: Director, Partner Field Sales
description:
At Tanium, our partner ecosystem plays a critical role in helping our customers protect their organization, their people, and what matters most. Our technology allows customers to redefine what’s possible with the power of certainty. Expanding beyond transaction-focused product resale only partners, our partner ecosystem delivers mature relationships with consultancies, advisors, service providers and systems integrators to drive new business and expansion across customers.
   

  

 The Director, Partner Field Sales works within Tanium’s Global Partner Sales team to recruit, enable, and align our sales and technical teams with our partners to achieve regional and area sales targets. This role will own, develop and execute territory plans, account mapping exercises and partner services alignment supporting Tanium’s regional sales strategy.
   

  

**Essential Job Functions**
* Directly support sales leadership and partners to accelerate planning, customer prospecting and overall new customer and ARR growth.
* Align to sales regions to drive regional sales engagements with all partner types and pathways.
* Be the single point of contact for sales leadership within the region.
* Proactively work with partners to build and execute joint business and territory account mapping plans.
* Educate Tanium sales teams on partners unique value propositions and coach them on how to work with partners to increase their productivity
* Create a thoughtful partner GTM strategy for all sales leaders within region.
* Align key strategic partners to top prospects and accounts to drive large deals.
* Be highly proficient in understanding and delivering all aspects of Tanium’s value to
* both customers and partners.


**Minimum & Preferred Job Qualifications**
* 7+ years of experience in a regional or national partner sales role in the IT Operations and/or IT Security industry required
* Experience creating a geographic partner business or national/global partnership
* Experience as a quota carrying seller or business development position with a successful track record strongly preferred
* Proactive style, capable of hands-on problem-solving, with the ability to generate ideas and solutions
* Ability to effectively communicate with technical, business development, sales, and executive roles
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to operate independently while managing internal and external stakeholder relationships
* Ability to enthusiastically evangelize the Tanium message to strategic partners and their customers
* Desire to own all parts of a partner lifecycle, starting with profiling/recruitment
* Proven success with sales ability and demonstrated knowledge of sales process


**About Tanium**
 Tanium, the industry’s only provider of converged endpoint management (XEM), leads the paradigm shift in legacy approaches to managing complex security and technology environments. Only Tanium protects every team, endpoint, and workflow from cyber threats by integrating IT, Operations, Security, and Risk into a single platform that delivers comprehensive visibility across devices, a unified set of controls, and a common taxonomy for a single shared purpose: to protect critical information and infrastructure at scale. Tanium has been named to the Forbes Cloud 100 list for six consecutive years and ranks on Fortune’s list of the Best Large Workplaces in Technology. In fact, more than half of the Fortune 100 and the U.S. armed forces trust Tanium to protect people; defend data; secure systems; and see and control every endpoint, team, and workflow everywhere. That’s the power of certainty. Visit www.tanium.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.
   

  

**On a mission. Together.**
 At Tanium, we are stewards of a culture that emphasizes the importance of collaboration, respect, and diversity. In our pursuit of revolutionizing the way some of the largest enterprises and governments in the world solve their most difficult IT challenges, we are strengthened by our unique perspectives and by our collective actions.
   

  

 We are an organization with stakeholders around the world and it’s imperative that the diversity of our customers and communities is reflected internally in our team members. We strive to create a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone feels they have opportunities to succeed and grow because we know that only together can we do great things.
   

  

**Taking care of our team members**
 Each of our team members has 5 days set aside as volunteer time off (VTO) to contribute to the communities they live in and give back to the causes they care about most.
   

  

 For more information on how Tanium processes your personal data, please see our Privacy Policy

title: Growth Account Manager
description:
**Welcome to Eficode!**
 We are building the future of software development - specialising in Cloud, DevOps, Agile, and Development. We help our customers transform into software-driven organisations, aiming to change the world by sharing our knowledge. Our employees value: opportunities for growth, psychological safety and culture - we appreciate our laid-back and autonomous, but supportive atmosphere.
   

  

**We’re now looking for a Growth Account Manager (B2B). In this role, you will:**
* Manage existing clients in our Growth segment and make them grow
* Nurture a smaller number of prospect accounts to win them over
* Be accountable for all Eficode business in the assigned customer accounts


**This Role Is For You If You**
* enjoy contributing to your customers' success
* are business-oriented
* like working with people and positively influencing them
* are motivated by connecting opportunities to solutions


**To Be Successful In This Role, You**
* Manage existing clients in Growth segment (account load based on region, typically around 15 – 25) and actively farm, grow and expand these accounts
* Pursue and land qualified leads; hunt for new opportunities from internal sources (e.g., demand generation, marketing, partner leads)
* Actively pursue expansion opportunities across full portfolio with a focus to shift account mix in account
* Proactively account plan and implement account strategy, including resource orchestration (grow network/stakeholders in the account)
* Coordinate with specialists from business area specialists to maximize footprint in accounts
* Apply both offering and IT Services market knowledge to the understanding of client needs within across wholistic Eficode solutions
* Focus on growing market share with clients and enhance their capabilities through working with business area specialists
* Works with support functions (license sales & CSM, as needed) for account management and to ensure customer satisfaction and retention
* Work in collaboration with delivery consultants, service managers, and CSMs to ensure efficient delivery of Eficode solutions


**Qualifications**
 Education:
   

  

* Post high school degree in sales/it-sales


**Experience**
* Minimum 5 years of similar B2B sales experience, preferably from the software industry and/or it consulting services
* Experience using CRM software, preferably Salesforce to guide your work


**Skills**
* Skilled in value based & custom centric selling methods
* Languages; Strong command of Swedish since you will be working in Sweden with Swedish customers & colleagues and also English which is our corporate language, and also the language of many of our customers.


**Competencies**
* Strong communicator, ability to uncover customers needs and devise applicable and sometimes complex it solutions
* Comfortable in using digital means of communication like email, chat & video conferencing tools.


**Practicalities**
**Employment Terms**
 The role is a full time position, 40 hours per week, office hours 8-17, with ability to flex. We use 6-month probationary period for all new employees
   

  

**Work Environment**
 The majority of the work takes place in one of our lovely Swedish offices and we are open to part of the job being done remote, but you need to be able to commute at least 3 days a week to the office.
   

  

**Reporting**
 The role reports to the Head of Sales for Sweden.
   

  

 Location:
   

  

 Stockholm, Göteborg or Malmö
   

  

**Benefits**
 Key Benefits include pension program, health insurance and wellness allowance.
   

  

**Why us?**
* Eficode is a fusion of bright minds working on groundbreaking projects
* We provide opportunities to work with leading businesses in Europe and the US
* We work in a diverse environment that respects experience, nurtures talent, and encourages growth
* Open collaboration and clear communication are the cornerstones of our organisational culture
* With our own Efi Academy, internal trainings and mentoring program, we are committed to supporting your development
* On top of your compensation, we offer an attractive package of benefits, from sport, culture and well-being to childcare
* We offer flexible and remote work opportunities so you can shape your work in the way that fits you best


 Do you want to know more about how it is to work at Eficode? Our colleagues will tell you here :)
   

  

 Please note that this role is available in Stockholm, Göteborg or Malmö. We're looking forward to receiving your application, until the 15th of August! (
 *Please note that July is the main holiday season in Sweden so you should expect to hear from us in the August time frame* 
 ).
   

  

*At Eficode we are committed to offering an inclusive recruitment process and equal opportunities for all applicants.*
*We are dedicated to creating a work environment that embraces diversity, inclusion, and respect for all employees. We believe that our differences make us better. We recognize that by having diverse perspectives, skills, ages, genders, backgrounds and cultures we will better drive our customers forward and innovate in our field.*
*To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from sharing unnecessary personal information and your picture on your job application.*
*Eficode, better made possible.*

title: Sustainability Senior Manager - Net Zero Lead
description:
**Sustainability at Accenture**
 We collaborate closely with clients and ecosystem partners top help transition industries to low-carbon energy; design and deliver net-zero circular supply chains and reduce the carbon footprint of IT, cloud, and software. Through deep industry expertise, analytics, and insights, we empower clients to survive and thrive in the new, the now and the unknown.
   

  

 Through Sustainability Strategy, we help clients identify new areas for growth, new ways to increase efficiency and reduce cost, and new means to build trust and reputation, while addressing sustainability issues and global constraints. By focusing on sustainability as a means for value creation, we help business leaders build trust and transparency, and create competitive advantage.
   

  

**Position Overview:** 
 The Senior Manager - Net Zero Lead, will play a pivotal role in our organization, leading the Nordic Sustainability Strategy Net Zero efforts internally within Accenture and externally in the market. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 8 years of experience, a solid background in sustainability/net zero/climate, with strong experience in the renewable energy sector, and preferable prior consulting experience.
 **This role requires** 
 collaboration with various industry and market teams to deliver impactful projects, including climate compliance, carbon intelligence, energy transition and management, capital projects, and decarbonization strategies.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
- Lead Net Zero strategy in the Nordics: Be the point person for Net Zero within our sustainability strategy team in the Nordics externally and internally.

- Client Project Management: Manage and deliver impactful client projects related to climate compliance, carbon intelligence, energy transition and management, capital projects, and decarbonization strategies.

- Collaboration: Work closely with industry teams to leverage expertise and deliver comprehensive sustainability solutions.

- Business Development: Identify and pursue new business opportunities in the utilities sector and other relevant industries.

- Thought Leadership: Stay up to date with the latest industry trends, regulatory changes, and best practices in sustainability and climate action.

- Stakeholder Engagement: Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, industry partners, and internal teams to facilitate collaboration and drive project success.

- Team Leadership: Mentor and guide junior team members, fostering a collaborative and high-performing work environment.

**What´s in it for you:** 
 Accenture is an incredible place to work. By joining us, you’ll become part of a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Besides the work we do for our clients, we’re proud of our vibrant, diverse workplace culture: we believe in openness and honesty, fairness and equality, common sense and realism. Our commitment to you includes:
   

  

  

- A transparent approach to career progression, with a focus on your strengths and continuous coaching from senior colleagues.

- Competitive salary, good bonus schemes, occupational pension schemes and other benefits

- Ability to craft your career based on your own aspirations, having support from your own People Lead.

- Work-life balance: good arrangements to combine family life with work and active support for mental health.

- Opportunities to get involved in corporate citizenship initiatives, from volunteering to doing charity work, as well Inclusion & Diversity network.

**Qualifications:**
- Experience: Minimum of 8 years of experience in sustainability/net zero/climate, in the renewable energy sector, and preferably in consulting.

- Education: Bachelor’s degree in environmental science, Sustainability, Engineering, Business, or a related field. A master’s degree is preferred.

- Technical Skills: Proven experience with climate compliance, carbon intelligence, energy transition and management, capital projects, and decarbonization strategies. Experience with SAP is highly desirable.

- Project Management: Strong project management skills with a track record of successfully delivering complex projects on time and within budget.

- Business Acumen: Demonstrated ability to develop new business opportunities and lead proposal development.

- Communication: Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts to diverse audiences.

- Collaboration: Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and build strong relationships with clients and partners.

- Leadership: Strong leadership skills with experience in mentoring and guiding team members.

- 

 Preferred office location: Stockholm or Copenhagen.
   

  

 Interested?
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible by attaching your CV, cover letter and your educational documents including grades.
   

  

**Thank you for your interest in joining Accenture. Due to the summer holiday season, our response time might be a bit longer than usual. Please note that we will review your application in August and get back to you shortly after.** 
**About Sustainability Strategy**
 We are a global practice within Accenture Strategy & Consulting, working closely with clients and ecosystem partners top help transition industries to low-carbon energy; design and deliver net-zero circular supply chains and reduce the carbon footprint of IT, cloud and software.
   

  

 Through deep industry expertise, analytics and insights, we empower clients to survive and thrive in the new, the now and the unknown. To stay agile in a world dominated by change, the C-suite must keep the core business running while simultaneously identifying and investing in the new. Accenture Strategy & Consulting enables leaders to act quickly and confidently as they pivot to the future. Known for our ability to execute at speed, we help clients determine clear, actionable paths to competitive agility by bringing them new thinking on business and technology.
 **About Accenture**
 Accenture is a leading global corporation offering a wide range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digitalization, technology, and operations. Accenture has approximately 740,000 employees serving clients in more than 120 countries, addressing the challenges faced by companies, organizations, and agencies with enthusiasm, knowledge, insight, and technology.
 **Equal Employment Opportunity Statement**
 All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.
   

  

 Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.
   

  

 Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

title: Marsh is seeking a Client Executive for our Credit Specialties Team
description:
Are you interested in working in an international company with high-performing colleagues and international clients? Marsh AB is currently seeking a Client Executive for our Credit Specialty Team, which works with credit and political risks.
   

  

 This role is for someone with a keen interest in global trade, trade finance, and political risks. We work closely with exporters and banks to cover credit risks, analyze solutions, and facilitate financing of international trade. If you have experience in these areas and are also a skilled Account Manager, then you are a perfect fit for this role. The fact that we are directly involved in business solutions makes the work educational, diverse, and rewarding, while also enabling actual export transactions.
   

  

 At Marsh, you will have the opportunity to influence the company's operations, develop within your profession, and become part of a team with competent and inspiring colleagues. Our international structure provides significant opportunities to gain extensive expertise in our field.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Work with Trade Credit Insurance and insure entire customer portfolios for banks and corporates
* Have direct client responsibility for Global Export Companies based in Sweden but operating worldwide.
* Be responsible for insurance procurement for our clients.
* Compile presentations and materials to be presented to insurers during procurement processes.
* Assist clients with daily inquiries regarding credit limits on their domestic and international customers, as well as answer insurance-related questions.
* Assist in arranging financing solutions for receivables finance.
* Build relationships with both our clients and insurers and maintain ongoing dialogue with both parties.


**We offer you:**
* To become part of a the most innovative on the market, consisting of experienced and competent colleagues and a good working environment, with opportunities to be challenged and grow within our field
* Direct client responsibility for large accounts
* A varied role with a lot of personal responsibility and significant development potential
* Many different local and international contacts, both internally and externally
* Placement in central Stockholm
* A permanent position starting as soon as possible


**We are looking for someone who:**
* Is curious about and interested in international trade
* Is innovative, methodical, meticulous, and reliable


 Interested in making a difference? Apply now with your CV. Due to GDPR we only accept applicants through Workday.
   

  

 Marsh is the world’s leading insurance broker and risk advisor. With more than 45,000 colleagues advising clients in over 130 countries, Marsh serves commercial and individual clients with data-driven risk solutions and advisory services. Marsh is a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. With annual revenue of $23 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. For more information, visit marsh.com, and follow us on LinkedIn and X.
   

  

**R\_264469**

title: Sales and Marketing interns
description:
Digisource Consulting AB is a young and innovation-driven software solutions and IT consulting company based in Stockholm. Our goal for digital transformation is to leverage the power of digital technologies to transform and improve the way businesses operate, deliver value to customers, and achieve strategic objectives. We strive to create new business models, better service levels & higher competitiveness, increase internal collaboration, optimized processes, increased efficiency, and improved employee performance & compliance with data security.
   

  

 Innovation drives Digisource and we have adopted People, Process, and Technology as the cornerstones of our digital transformation. We have successfully developed and taken to market a disruptive AI-driven HCM solution in the cloud. We are creating a digital advantage for HR and employees through Human Capital Management (HCM) solutions. We also work in the area of CRM, digital mobility, application development and management.
   

  

 We are bold and confident to confront existing solutions and try out new ideas to evaluate future potential. We believe that technology works to achieve business goals. We work closely with our customers to understand their business goals first and then map them to an appropriate solution.
   

  

 We are currently looking for
 **business development interns** 
 to spur our growth. This internship is an exciting opportunity to gain hands-on experience in sales and marketing. Your responsibilities will include Customer reach out through social media marketing, Lead generation, and pre-sales activities. The internship is for a period of 3-6 months starting in July.
   

  

 We are looking for a self-starter with lots of energy, a positive outlook, good communicator and ability to think out of the box on their feet. You will have access to multiple digital tools in the business development process. This internship will get you up and ready as an efficient sales and marketing professional.
   

  

**For more information or questions please contact us at** 
 droy@digisourceconsulting.com

title: Sr. Analytics Specialist SA,EU North, AGS-EMEA-Europe North-WWSO
description:
**Description**
 Are you passionate about helping customers build Analytics and cloud solutions?
   

  

 Come join us ! Work from Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Copenhagen, Oslo or Stockholm
   

  

 AWS Specialist Solutions Architects (SSAs) are technologists with deep domain-specific expertise, able to address advanced concepts and feature designs. As part of the AWS sales organization, SSAs work with customers who have complex challenges that require expert-level knowledge to solve. SSAs craft scalable, flexible, and resilient technical architectures that address those challenges. This might involve guiding customers as they refactor an application or designing entirely new cloud-based systems.
   

  

 Analytics Specialist Solutions Architects combine technical skills in analytics, business acumen, and technical sales skills. They are focused on supporting customers throughout the engagement lifecycle and work closely with the teams that support implementation including AWS Professional Services and Partners. SSAs unblock customers and help them get to production faster. Joining AWS as a Specialist Solutions Architect will give you opportunities to work on interesting and challenging problems, collaborate with a group of skilled practitioners focused on delivering outcomes for our customers, and be part of a diverse and inclusive community committed to being Earth’s Best Employer.
   

  

 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As a key member of the AWS Europe North Specialist Solutions Architecture team your work will include:
   

  

* Working closely with our product and field teams, you will help enable new capabilities for our customers to develop and deploy data workloads on AWS infrastructure
* Design best in class storage infrastructure solutions for all stages of customer and product lifecycles.
* You will have the technical depth and business experience to deploy storage and data strategies.
* Partner with SAs, Sales, Business Development and Service teams to accelerate customer adoption and revenue attainment.
* You will also work closely with account teams, research scientists, and product teams to drive model implementations and new solutions.
* Thought Leadership - Evangelize and share best practices through forums such as AWS blogs, whitepapers, reference architectures and public-speaking events such as AWS Summit, AWS re: Invent, etc.
* Act as a technical liaison between customers and the AWS teams to provide customer driven product improvement feedback.
* Develop and support an AWS internal community of related subject matter experts.


**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Hybrid Work
   

  

 We value innovation and recognize this sometimes requires uninterrupted time to focus on a build. We also value in-person collaboration and time spent face-to-face. Our team affords employees options to work in the office every day or in a flexible, hybrid work model near one of our Sweden Amazon offices.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* 7+ years of design, implementation, or consulting in applications and infrastructures experience
* 5+ years of specific technology domain areas (e.g. software development, cloud computing, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data & analytics) experience
* Bachelor's degree
* 5+ years of technology/software sales experience
* 3+ years of implementation and architecture experience in big data, data warehousing, data lake, operational analytics, data migration, and integration scenarios. (Amazon EMR, Hadoop, Spark, R, Presto, Hive, Amazon Redshift, Teradata, Vertica, Glue, Data Migration Services)


**Preferred Qualifications**
* AWS expertise primarily familiarity with the AWS analytics stack would be nice to have but not a necessity.
* Understanding of application, server and network security, particularly as they relate to data security in the Analytics space.


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch) - G54
   

  

 Job ID: A2634852

title: Infrastrukturspecialist inriktning Linux
description:
*Svenska kraftnät är en av de viktigaste aktörerna för en hållbar energiomställning. Hos oss erbjuds du ett viktigt jobb, i vilket du kommer att bidra till Sveriges elförsörjning. Vi behöver dig för att lyckas med vårt samhällsviktiga uppdrag att elektrifiera Sverige.*
*Vi är i dag ca 500 personer på IT och vi kommer att växa med ytterligare de kommande åren. Detta för att kunna skapa förutsättningar för Sverige att kunna fördubbla sin elproduktion och nå klimatmålen genom att helt ställa om till fossilfri energi. För att lyckas kommer vi att använda oss av den senaste tekniken för att öka kapaciteten i vår infrastruktur och samtidigt öka utvecklingstakten kring system, digitalisering och processer.*
 Om tjänsten
   

  

 Tjänsten innebär att arbeta i vår komplexa IT-leverans av samhällskritisk IT-infrastruktur. Du kommer att vara med på en spännande resa när vi expanderar och bygger en ny plattform. Med egen kontroll över drift och utveckling av samtliga lager av infrastrukturen har Svenska kraftnät stort fokus på att öka leveransförmågan för att lyckas digitalisera kraftsystemet, ställa om till förnybar el och på sikt fördubbla elproduktionen. Vi är en IT-tung organisation som gör stora investeringar.
   

  

 Du blir delaktig och bidrar i den nya tekniska plattformen med möjlighet att påverka framtida teknikval och lösningar. Vi fokuserar på säkerhet när vi inför nya arbetssätt, automatiserar och ökar robusthet och hastighet.
   

  

 Du kommer att tillhöra enheten Server Infrastruktur. Teamet arbetar och förstår tekniken på djupet och ser till helheten i miljön. Tillsammans bygger vi upp system och teknikplattformar. Vi arbetar med metoder och produkter så som AD, PKI, PowerShell, VMware och Azure DevOps.
   

  

 I rollen ingår att arbeta med drift, förvaltning och utveckling inom vår Linux plattform. Du hanterar ärenden som incidenter och beställningar, deltar i projekt och planering av teamets aktiviteter. Vi arbetar enligt ITIL och PM3.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifterna kommer att anpassas efter din erfarenhet inom området. Hos oss finns goda utvecklingsmöjligheter.
   

  

 Om dig
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är
   

  

* bra på att samarbeta och som tar initiativ
* nyfiken på teknik och har förmåga och vilja att ta till dig nya kunskaper och är positiv till utveckling och förändring
* flexibel och anpassningsbar efter arbetsbelastning
* ödmjuk, har lätt för att skapa förtroende och är och tydlig i din kommunikation
* resultatinriktad med ett stort intresse för att skapa hållbara och säkra IT-lösningar.


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Vidare Ser Vi Att Du Har Examen Inom IT Eller Motsvarande Kompetens Förvärvad På Annat Sätt. Du Har Även
   

  

* Aktuell och relevant erfarenhet inom IT-infrastruktur med fokus mot Linux
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* B-körkort


 Vi ser det som meriterande om du har erfarenhet av förvaltning och drift av Unix system och/eller har erfarenhet av att bygga skript i BASH, Ansible eller Python.
   

  

 Bra att veta
   

  

* Tjänsten är placerad i Sundbyberg
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 %
* Sista ansökningsdag 2024-09-16. Vi tar inte emot personligt brev i samband med din ansökan
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidaretjänst utan provanställning
* Beredskapsarbete ingår i tjänsten


 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med IDG Recruitment. Vid frågor kontakta rekryteringskonsult Oscar Nordström, oscar.nordstrom@foundryco.com alternativt Maria Sahlén rekryterare hos Svenska kraftnät, 010-489 20 27, maria.sahlen2@svk.se. Fackliga representanter är Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010 475 87 72 och Mikael Hedenheim, ST, tel. 010-475 84 68. Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se.
   

  

*Under semestertider nås vi på mail och svarstiden kan vara längre än vanligt* 
 .
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning på Svenska kraftnät krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras.
   

  

 För mer information om säkerhetsprövning Svenska kraftnät arbetar för att främja mångfald och motverka diskriminering och ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter till våra rekryteringar. Lär känna Svenska kraftnät och hur det är att arbeta hos oss: Lär känna oss på Svenska kraftnät

title: Embedded C++ Full Stack Engineer, Consumer Experience
description:
We’re looking for a Embedded C++ Full Stack Engineer to join our Home Consumer Electronics product area. Our team is focusing on making Spotify the best possible experience in the home. We work with all kinds of technologies and devices including Touch, Voice, TVs, Speakers, Spotify Connect etc. In this role, you will be working mostly with Gaming Consoles and TVs but across several different technologies ranging from our JavaScript SDK to our internal C++ libraries.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* You will work in close relationship with Spotify’s different partners in, mainly, the gaming console space
* You will be part of handling both business and technical relationship with said partners
* Deliver testable, maintainable and high-quality code
* You will collaborate closely with other engineers and become a valued member of an autonomous, cross-functional team
* You will help the team plan, design and craft maintainable and easily reusable integrations in an iterative manner
* Ensure that our users experience is the very best it can be
* Be part of exploring future system design and improving our architecture in a complex domain
* Work in an environment that supports your individual growth


 Who You Are
   

  

* You know how to build user-friendly, data-rich JavaScript/HTML/CSS/Typescript applications and also has knowledge in C++
* You are experienced with modern JavaScript coding, UI frameworks, testing, debugging and automation techniques
* You enjoy working with third parties and external integrations
* You have a working understanding of object oriented and functional programming paradigms
* You have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, and can communicate your ideas
* You value team success over personal success
* A degree in Computer Science or a similar area and music experience are bonuses but not mandatory


 Where You´ll Be
   

  

* For this role you will be based in Stockholm, Sweden


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Fullstack engineer with frontend expertise
description:
This is Mevisio
   

  

*Mevisio is a fast-growing scale-up offering a low-code platform that digitizes management and collaboration in the manufacturing industry.*
 We provide a digital alternative to the physical whiteboards traditionally used for daily team meetings on the shop floor, with applications extending to general operations management and other Lean Manufacturing practices. The Mevisio Platform is a tool for leaders and team members to help them work smarter and more efficiently with the help of visualization and improved communication. Mevisio is highly customizable to the specific requirements of each client, including layout of boards and integrations with other systems, that allows the platform to solve the different needs of each company.
   

  

 Our main clientele comprises large enterprise industries, globally operating companies, and we've expanded our user base to over 50 countries in just a couple of years and there is much more to come!
   

  

*We are revolutionizing the way manufacturing industries operate. Sounds cool, right?*
 🚀
 **Why Mevisio?**
 When walking into the office at Mevisio, you will meet passionate, collaborative, and kind people. We are a fast-growing SaaS company underway to visualize the manufacturing industry and redefine its future. To succeed - we need more awesome people like YOU on our team!
   

  

 We love cross-functional collaboration and value your thoughts both in engineering and developing the product. We challenge ourselves to become better in everything that we do where each individual matters! We work hard to be a workplace where we feel motivated and engaged and we have a fantastic platform and market to conquer - let’s do that together! 🎆
   

  

 🔍
 **About the role?**
 As a Fullstack Engineer at Mevisio, you'll join a dynamic cross-functional product team dedicated to a well-defined product discovery and delivery process. You will have the chance to hone your skills by building and enhancing our innovative low-code platform, which seamlessly integrates programming, API design, and various languages within the actual product.
   

  

 Our ideal candidate boasts strong frontend expertise and a passion for sharing knowledge with the team. Given that our platform heavily relies on data visualization, evolving the frontend architecture and platform is crucial as we expand. You'll face exciting challenges such as making the architecture more robust, automating testing, refining our design system, and tackling performance-related issues.
   

  

 We embrace a fullstack strategy, fostering true team collaboration. You'll work with technologies like GraphQL, Node.js, MongoDB, Redis, and Elasticsearch, and we expect you to be confident in these areas. Our frontend is built on React and React Native.
   

  

*What else can you expect in your daily work?*
 🔹 Discover, Define, Develop and Deliver features and capabilities within our digital management platform
   

  

 🔹 Fixing bugs, improving performance, and ensuring compatibility across browsers and devices
   

  

 🔹 Participate in code reviews to ensure code quality according to standards and best practices
   

  

 🔹 Dive deep into complex technical challenges, from backend infrastructure to frontend interfaces
   

  

 🔹 Contribute to a culture of continuous learning and growth
   

  

 💪
 **What we think you will bring to us!**
 🔹 Master's Degree in Computer Science
   

  

 🔹 5+ years of relevant working experience with tech
   

  

 🔹 Passion for technology and a constant hunger for innovation
   

  

 🔹 A collaborative spirit and excellent communication skills
   

  

 🔹 A great mindset of team spirit, inspiration and knowledge sharing to colleagues
   

  

**Other Perks And Benefits**
 🏖️ 30 paid holidays
   

  

 🤸🏻 Attractive wellness contribution
   

  

 📈 Pension plan
   

  

 🔕 Flexible working hours and hybrid office set-up
   

  

 🧑🏾‍💻 New tech gear - got that covered
   

  

 👨‍👩‍👧 Work-life balance
   

  

 ⛷️ Team gatherings
   

  

 🏢 Central Office
   

  

***If you think this sounds cool - don't miss out the chance to meet this fantastic team!***

title: Data Engineers till Stockholm
description:
Data Engineer till Stockholm som vill lösa uppgifter genom modern teknik, tillsammans med ett stort nätverk Data- och Analysexperter.
   

  

*Är du en erfaren Dataingenjör, BI-utvecklare/BI-konsult eller ETL-utvecklare? Drömmer du om att fortsätta din professionella resa tillsammans med ett team kunniga kollegor? Motiveras du av att arbeta med moderna teknologier och lösa problem för kunder inom olika branscher kan DU vara vår nästa Dataingenjör!*
 På Solita handlar allt om att förbättra företag och forma en ljusare framtid genom att dra nytta av kraften av data i vår uppkopplade värld. Tänk dig detta: våra kunder sträcker sig över alla olika branscher och områden, vi finns överallt! Som ett sammanhållet team av IT-experter är vi för närvarande 1700 personer spridda över sex länder. I Sverige arbetar våra dataexperter med en stor och mångsidig projektpool där de bygger datamodeller, skapar innovativa dataplattformar och skapar molnbaserade datapipelines, samt mycket mer!
   

  

**Träffa en Solitan**
 Möt
 **Clara Lundström,** 
 en Data Engineer här på Solita. Hon arbetar i ett projekt för ett globalt företag inom facility service, det största i Norden. Clara, tillsammans med ett team av Solita-entusiaster, belyser datalandskapet och använder data från olika källor för att skapa visualiseringar. Erfaren med molnverktyg arbetar hon med data, automation och transformation.
   

  

*“Att arbeta som konsult på Solita är varierat samtidigt som du har tillgång till ett stort nätverk av experter inom många olika områden. Det ger utmärkta möjligheter att utvecklas i din roll, vare sig det handlar om att bredda dina kunskaper eller specialisera dig. Anledningen till att jag trivs så bra på Solita är den vänliga, stödjande och opretentiösa atmosfären.”*
**Hur är det att jobba på Solita?**
 Solitas företagskultur är annorlunda många andra företags, den handlar om autonomi, att stötta och växa tillsammans med våra kollegor samt att leva våra värdeord – passion, courage, easy-going och caring.
   

  

 Rent konkret innebär det ett företag som har genomtänkta interna tillväxtvägar, att det finns spännande kundprojekt och erfarna kollegor som är omtänksamma och passionerade. Du kommer också få chansen att arbeta med en stor bredd av projekt och branscher där du stöttar och hjälper kund med faktiska affärspåverkande beslut som lämnar avtryck och består. Utöver detta har vi även partnerskap med en mängd tech-företag såsom, GCP, AWS, Snowflake för att nämna några.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 På Solita värdesätter vi att du har erfarenhet av teknik och kommunikation på både svenska och engelska. Tekniska förmågor som ETL/ELT, python, SQL, DBT, Snowflake och verktyg inom orkestrering samt datamodellering och datawarehousing är något som ofta används i det dagliga arbetet. Våra kunder arbetar ofta i cloud-miljöer så kunskap i tekniker som Azure, GCP och AWS behövs. Om du kan något visualiseringsverktyg är även det ett plus i kanten, gärna PowerBI eller Tableau.
   

  

 Som konsult på Solita handlar arbetet inte bara om det tekniska – att kommunicera med kund i förklaring av tekniska lösningar, tolkande av deras behov och att hantera potentiella problem du kommer få hantera så vana med att kommunicera med stakeholders och kunder är en bra erafarenhet. Vi arbetar autonomt på Solita, så att vara van att diktera och planera upp sitt arbete självständigt behövs.
   

  

**En Dag På Solita**
 En dag på Solita kan ofta starta med ett standup-möte med kund och dina team-medlemmar, där ni stämmer av agendan för dagen för veckan. Sen kliver du in i ditt kodnära arbete: byggande av data pipelines, programmering i python/SQL, arbete med data och byggande i cloud. Under dagen kan det dyka upp ad-hoc möten med kund, kollegor som behöver stöttning eller helt enkelt att du lyssnar på våra interna utbildningsmöten; infosessions, som kan handla om allt relaterat till Solita och branschen. Dagen fortsätter ofta med det kod nära arbetet, möten med kollegor och kund och inte minst – fika!
   

  

 Du kan även ha interna projekt såsom att köra en dragning på vår Data Academy eller annat på din to-do list!
   

  

 Do you want to learn more about what it is like working at Solita as a Data Engineer? Read more about Lisa and her Story here! https://www.solita.fi/blogs/people-of-solita-lisa-kyhlberg-senior-data-engineer/
   

  

**Intresserad?**
 Vid frågor; kontakta jacob.beck(at)solita.se eller ansök här. Du kan också connecta med Jacob på LinkedIn på https://www.linkedin.com/in/jacob-beck-/. Vi uppskattar dina färdigheter, men vi är också ivriga att lära oss om essensen i din motivation och hur du ser din tillväxt framför dig. Dela ditt CV nedan så återkommer vi så fort vi kan!

title: Back End Senior Software Engineer (Bangkok based – Relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team**
 In Agoda’s Back-End Engineering department, we build scalable, fault-tolerant systems and APIs that host our core business logic. Our systems cover all major areas of our business: inventory and pricing, product information, customer data, communications, partner data, booking systems, payments, and more. We employ state-of-the-art CI/CD and testing techniques to ensure everything works without downtime. Our systems are self-healing, responding gracefully to extreme loads or unexpected input. We use modern languages like Kotlin and Scala, Data technologies Kafka, Spark, MLflow, Kubeflow, VastStorage, StarRocks and agile development practices. Most importantly, we hire great people from around the world and empower them to be successful.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 Agoda Platform team is looking for developers to work on mission-critical systems that serve millions of users daily. You will have the chance to work on innovative projects, using cutting-edge technologies, and make a significant impact on our business and the travel industry.
   

  

**What You’ll Need To Succeed**
* 5+ years of experience developing performance-critical applications in a production environment using Scala, Java, Kotlin, C#, Go or relevant modern programming languages.
* Strong RDBMS knowledge (SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL, or other).
* Ability to design and implement scalable architectures
* Deeply involved in hands-on coding, developing and maintaining high-quality software solutions on a daily basis
* Good command of the English language.
* Engages in cross-team collaborations to ensure cohesive solutions
* Implement advanced CI/CD pipelines and robust testing strategies to ensure seamless integration, deployment, and high code quality.
* Passion for software development and continuous improvement of your knowledge and skills.


**It’s Great if You Have**
* Knowledge in NoSQL, Queueing systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, MSMQ), and Play framework.

 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
